name: Eat for Eight Bucks: Baked Sweet Potato 'Fries'
description: A plain baked sweet potato is incredibly tasty, as far as I'm concerned, but Ina Garten's brown-sugared baked sweet potato fries are out of this world. Although I usually leave the peels on (out of laziness and a longstanding belief that the peels contain good stuff), they are even better peeled. With or without peeling, they come together very quickly and make a nice side for an easy and inexpensive meal of hot dogs or hamburgers.
recipeIngredient: 2 medium to large sweet potatoes, peeled
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus extra for sprinkling

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Halve the sweet potatoes lengthwise and cut each half into 3 long spears. Combine the brown sugar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Put the potato spears on a sheet pan and toss with the olive oil. Spread them in one layer and sprinkle with the brown sugar mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes and then turn with a spatula. Bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, until lightly browned. Sprinkle lightly with salt and serve hot.
